item.title: Chris Kempczinski, CEO of McDonald‚Äôs Corporation, is asked if Kevin Ozan‚Äôs departure is related to the criminal RICO case targeting them.
item.description: Click this link to see the original LinkedIn post. Dear Mr. Kempczinski, Is Mr. Ozan‚Äôs departure related to the criminal RICO case targeting McDonald’s Corporation and if yes, to which extent is it related? (look at the screenshot üëá to understand) You also mention Mr. Ozan‚Äôs ‚Äúunwavering integrity,‚Äù could you please confirm he reported internally my stern warnings about the crimes McDonald‚Äôs is engaging into? As the CFO, he obviously should have understood McDonald’s Corporation is engaging in money laundering, shouldn’t he?

item.title: Nicolai Tangen and NBIM‚Äôs executives asked who is the anti-money laundering officer at Norges Bank Investment Management
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Date sent: May 2, 2023, 15:29 (Beijing time) Cc: Nicolai Tangen (CEO of NBIM) Cc: Ida Wolden Bache (Governor of Norges Bank), Trond Grande (Deputy CEO of NBIM), Carine Smith Ihenacho (NBIM), Dag Huse (CRO of NBIM) Open letter/communication, submitted via a LinkedIn post, to Nicolai Tangen, CEO of Norges Bank Investment Management corporation, and CC’ed to various executives and the @FBI, in reply to his LinkedIn post whether ‚ÄúCan you spot the dragon?

item.title: LinkedIn post to Nicolai Tangen, Chief Executive Officer at Norges Bank Investment Management
item.description: Visualize the original post directly on LinkedIn by clicking this link. Dear Mr. Nicolai Tangen, This post will be published on McDStockInvestors (.) com which I created for the purpose of listing the notifications I send to investors in an entity you are currently financing through Norges Bank Investment Management. The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is being actively notified (cc Jarrad Smith Adam Rogalski Mahonri Manjarrez). I also intend to notify Finanstilsynet (FSA Norway) when I have more time.

item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald‚Äôs General Counsel CCed to McDonald‚Äôs CEO
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: additional frauds Date sent: 2015-10-22 11:06 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: ‚ÄúI sold my soul to McDonald‚Äôs‚Äù
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France, and later in Europe. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:

item.title: Fran√ßoise de Borda, former general counsel of McDonald‚Äôs France
item.description:
Via certified mail with proof of receipt requested

From: Fran√ßoise de Borda (Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

If I recall correctly, a copy of the mail was sent to a French Ministerial Officer who I now accuse of being corrupted.

Translation coming soon. (Note of 2023-04-13: quick note, this event happened in 2012 and I published it, if I am not mistaken, on 2022-09-21T20:49:00+08:00. Back then I wrote ‚Äútranslation coming soon‚Äù but I currently don’t have time to translate what was said in French. It’s an important event but not that important compared to what I am currently explaining to the FBI which is the priority.)

Fran√ßoise de Borda, directrice juridique de McDonald‚Äôs France, me r√©ponds pour la premi√®re et pour la derni√®re fois. Elle ment.
